transcript.title: THE HON KATHY SULLIVAN, MP
transcript.content:
The Hon Kathy Sullivan MP has advised me of her decision to resign as

Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister for Foreign Affairs.

I have accepted her resignation with effect from 12 noon on Monday 14

February 2000.

I want to thank her for her outstanding work as Alexander Downer's

Parliamentary Secretary.

In particular, I would like to pay tribute to the job she has done with

AusAID where her deep commitment and hard work has been especially noticeable.

Last June, she publicly indicated her intention to retire from parliament

at the end of this term.

Having completed a number of key tasks, she is now standing aside to

permit another parliamentary colleague to have the opportunity to contribute

to the work of the government.

I look forward to her continuing contribution to the Parliament and her

electorate until her retirement at the next election.

I will be making an announcement about her successor shortly.
